definitions.definition: To make invalid . Especially applied to contract law.
examples: The circuit court judge's ruling was invalidated by a superior judge.

definitions.definition: To make or declare (an argument, statement, or theory) unsound or erroneous; disprove .

examples: Telling an angry person to "calm down" can invalidate their feelings.

main_definition: To make invalid . Especially applied to contract law.
secondary_definitions: To make or declare (an argument, statement, or theory) unsound or erroneous; disprove .
